trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref uid="langword_csharp_Command" name="Command" href=""></xref> event.
The `Command` event is raised when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageButton> control is clicked.
The CommandEventArgs object contains data about the `Command` event that can be accessed in the event handler.

Using the properties available in the CommandEventArgs class, you can determine the name of the command to perform, such as `Sort`, in addition to an optional argument that supplements the command, such as `Ascending`.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of CommandEventArgs, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs"></xref> class with another <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs"></xref> object.

Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs> class using the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs> object.
When an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs> is created by a call to this constructor, the following properties are initialized to the specified values.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |CommandName|The `e.CommandName` parameter.| |CommandArgument|The `e.CommandArgument` parameter.|
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs"></xref> class with the specified command name and argument.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs> class using the specified command name and argument.
When an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs> is created by a call to this constructor, the following properties are initialized to the specified values.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |CommandName|The value of the `commandName` parameter.| |CommandArgument|The value of the `argument` parameter.|
The name of the command.
A <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that contains the arguments for the command.
Gets the argument for the command.
The CommandArgument can contain any string set by the programmer.
The CommandArgument property complements the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName%2A> property by allowing you to provide any additional information for the command.

For example, you can set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs.CommandName%2A> property to `Sort` and set the CommandArgument property to `Ascending` to specify a command to sort in ascending order.
A <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that contains the argument for the command.
Gets the name of the command.
Use the CommandName property to determine the command to perform.
The CommandName property can contain any string set by the programmer.
The programmer can then identify the command name in code and perform the appropriate tasks.
The name of the command to perform.
